column2: Our Engineering Tech Operations team builds and operates sophisticated solutions for global business challenges that cross cultures, legal jurisdictions, and impacts millions of people and businesses every day   We hire people with a broad set of skills and people who want to work on creating never-been-done-before solutions at scale while ensuring world-class reliability and security   Our Agreement Cloud is a revolutionary solution that changes the way people live, work, and come to agreement   Were looking for a self-motivated, hands-on Integrations engineering manager, who will be leading a best-in-class engineering team   The ideal candidate will be passionate about building integrations and services between DocuSign and different key business partners   You will do this while working with a team of passionate people, who care about their customers and want to deliver quality solutions that improve customer productivity for complex workflows   The desired candidate will be a well-rounded developer, who is not afraid to jump into any level of the stack and has shown experience in web development, a flexible attitude and skills to learn and share   This person enjoys working in a fast-paced agile environment, cares about their decisions, and is focused on quality driven development   DocuSign currently supports several integrations, like Google Apps, Microsoft Dynamics, SharePoint, and NetSuite, and we are building a few key integrations   This role will be responsible for all these integrations        This position is a people manager role reporting to the Senior Director, Engineering.      Responsibilities     Help defines the vision and roadmap for DocuSigns integrations with a variety of applications   Lead a team of expert, senior engineers   Work as part of a multi-platform development team in the design, implementation, testing and release of new solutions   Engage externally with industry partners through blog posts, conference presentations, and early-access programs   Lead team to architect and build high-quality, ship-ready code with unit tests, logging and monitoring   Work with product and project team to understand and translate sending integration requirements into software requirements that are well defined, measurable and attainable   Own and deliver accurate effort estimations for each release cycle    Job Designation      Hybrid:   Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation)       Positions at DocuSign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within DocuSign. DocuSign reserves the right to change a positions job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law.    What you bring      Basic      12+ years of combined software development and management experience across at least 3 languages or paradigms, and frameworks or equivalent experience   8 + years of hands on software development or equivalent experience   3+ years of handling software organizations over 25 people or equivalent experience   Experience consuming and developing solutions that are highly interactive with internal/external APIs and web services   Experience with Saas or Cloud       Preferred      Knowledge and experience in high scale, highly available (99.99+) systems   Experience with Git, continuous integration and deployment tools   Experience working in an agile development environment   Curiosity and ability to learn new technologies and tool sets   Experience with Webhooks   Prior experience building an integrations platform/infrastructure to seamlessly integrate 3rd party applications

column2: The    PRogram   Synthesis using Examples (PROSE) team is a blended research and engineering team where engineers work side-by-side with researchers to do fundamental research while at the same time shipping innovations through flagship Microsoft products that impact millions of users worldwide.     These products include the world s most popular spreadsheet software Excel, the industry-leading IDEs Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code, the power platform suite of products including Power BI, PowerApps, PowerAutomate, and other software tools including Azure Data Studio, Azure Data Monitor, Azure Data Factory, PowerShell, and SQL Server Management Studio.         ?The application domains range from developer productivity, business user low-code/no-code scenarios to even programming education. To power these features      PROSE has developed a powerful and flexible framework for program synthesis that    leverages   techniques from both logical reasoning and machine learning (including LLMs) and combines them in unique ways to synthesize programs automatically. This approach has been recognized with frequent papers at top-tier conferences and awards, including best paper and test-of-time awards.               We invite experienced engineers who are ready for a new and very different challenge to apply for a full-time position on the PROSE team at Microsoft.   T     he recent success of large language models (LLMs) creates an opportunity to take a qualitative step forward, to extend dramatically the reach of what users can do with Copi   lots.      Our team provides a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of cutting-edge AI research and real-world impact, solving customer problems on a global scale.    Team members    design and carry out the research underlying state-of-the-art systems and work together to implement these systems in production.    To learn more about our approach and culture see this      award talk     on the story behind one of the team s early innovations: the Flash Fill feature in Excel.                Required Qualifications               5+ years of professional experience in software development                       Preferred Qualifications             BA/BS or MS Degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent additional years of professional experience in lieu of degree           Professional experience programming in C#, Typescript or Python           Must be able to work closely with other engineers and researchers on the team           Willingness to work with multiple products and technologies           Experience    working with Roslyn analyzers or compilers is a plus              If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .            Responsibilities               Drive    excellence in the team s engineering systems to enable productivity of the entire team.           W   ork closely with both researchers and other engineers to    deliver product features based on the team s cutting-edge research   .            Provide engineering guidance and mentorship to research fellows and other researchers on the team.

column2: We are hiring software engineers to join our team in building the next generation of our product offering   In this position, you will have an opportunity to make major contributions to our next generation transportation and logistics software for the marine industry   You will work together with colleagues around the world to define system requirements and build state-of-the-art software   You will make sure your solution is reliable, scalable to serve our enterprise customers on premise or in the cloud   You must be a quick learner and have excellent communication skills   This position has unique opportunities for growth in both the functional and technical direction       Key responsibilities include      Join an agile team coordinating with product managers, developers, and QA members    Design user interfaces, algorithms, data structures, test cases, and automated test suites for new functional modules of Navis software as directed by team and Programme Manager, in object oriented, .Net/C# and REACT programming languages    Keep up to date on new technologies and share knowledge with engineering teams    Submit major elements of new design for review by other team members prior to implementation    Debug elements of the software as required to maintain software quality of legacy and new code development    Prepare design documentation for new modules and new products    Write technical documents that explain how new modules and new products are implemented and assist in producing user documentation as required. Understand how they are used in the field by end users    Participate in the full life-cycle development process from definition and design to product delivery        About you      Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science or Master s Degree in Computer Science    3-5 years of professional experience in software development using Dot net [ .Net] , C# React    Solid object oriented background and experience designing and developing software in a commercial software development and/or consulting organization    Extremely good in coding in either object oriented programming or React and willing to work in both    Have a good understanding of Microsoft Windows Services, Web Service layers, and Rest services    Experience working in team-oriented environments, and working with other project stakeholders and functional groups    Must be self-motivated, proactive, and able to execute tasks independently and within a team environment    Strong written and verbal communication skills are a must, as is the ability to plan work, and report progress against plan    Highly motivated individual, who is ready to accept challenges, continually innovate and learn, and help others        Optional Qualifications      Experience with relational databases such as ORACLE, SQL Server, and/or MySql    Knowledge of marine terminals and container handling (or logistics industry)    Knowledge of Microservices and Cloud technologies    Experience working with non-co-located teams

column2: The Azure Storage team delivers Block, File and Object Storage platforms. as well as the foundation for service offerings across Microsoft. Come join the team to build the next generation of capabilities for Azure Files, a fully managed cloud file storage for customers to migrate and modernize applications on Azure. You can be part of a strategic team with Microsoft-wide and make industry-wide impact.   We are looking for a Product Manager with expertise in building scalable distributed systems with a proven track record for driving end-to-end product development and adoption. This role requires working knowledge of Linux based file systems and expertise engaging actively with the Linux Open-Source communities. You will be responsible for the end-to-end customer experience with the opportunity to deeply collaborate with partner teams both internal and external to Microsoft.           Required Qualifications:       Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related disciplines AND 4+ years experience in product/service/project/program management or software development     OR equivalent experience.       2+ years of experience       building or working with Linux File systems,     AND with data-driven insights creation, strategy definition, and experimentation,     AND of successful design, delivery, and iteration on complex projects with a diverse set of stakeholders.,     AND working with and influencing cross-functional stakeholders.     Quantitative and analytical skills, able to make informed tradeoffs, and able to break down and solve complex and often ambiguous problems.       Preferred Qualifications:       Bachelors Degree Computer Science, Engineering, or related disciplines AND 4+ years of experience in product/service/project/program management or software development     OR eqivalent experience.       3+ years of experience       managing or contributing to Linux Open-Source communities,     AND in shipping large scale products to external customers,     AND in analytical problem-solving, with ability to work with virtual teams through ambiguity.       Knowledge of on-premises storage systems or storage performanc.     Technical background and foundation in software engineering principles and architecture design.         Tasks                 You will drive and track success criteria of a feature group. you'll also identify short-term investment opportunities and collaborate with partners to garner support for that feature group.     You will research customer & partner scenarios and industry trends, understand customer requirements, and translate them into viable product roadmaps, strategy, delivery plan and track execution.     You will drive end-to-end product development including new ideas, product specifications, user experience, price-performance model, go to market plan and growth initiatives to remove friction in the customer experience.     You will collect and analyse performance metrics and usage patterns to incrementally improve product development in specific areas. you'll also learn to manage customer communities and help build trust with targeted customers.     You will collaborate with other Product Managers to build on their scenarios and to utilize data as a tool for extracting the insights around customer adoption of a feature set and drive next set of improvements that increase the adoption of the service.     You will work with Product Marketing to help build marketing, roll-out, and customer support plans. you'll also promote the feature you worked on and present at small events.
